label: electron microscope
definition: A microscope that produces an image of an object by targeting it with an electron beam

label: Faraday cage
definition: A device formed by conducting material or by a mesh of such material, that blocks out external static electric fields.

label: light emission device
definition: A device which has a function to emit light.
example of usage: A light source is an optical subsystem that provides light for use in a distant area using a delivery system (e.g., fiber optics)

label: perturbation device
definition: A perturbation device is a device which is designed to perform a perturb function
example of usage: |A homogenizer is a perturbation device.

label: environmental control device
definition: An environmental control device is a device which has the function to control some aspect of the environment such as temperature, or humidity.
example of usage: A growth chamber is an environmental control device.
function: ('heat function' or 'cool function' or 'environment control function')

label: angiograph
definition: A device that records the patterns of pulse waves inside blood vessels.

label: capillary blotter
definition: A device that is used to transfer nucleic acids from agarose gels onto a membrane, based on the movement of buffer from a reservoir through the gel and the blotting membrane to a stack of dry blotting paper by capillary force. The molecules are carried to the blotting membrane on which they are adsorbed.

label: bioreactor
definition: A device or system that supports a biologically active environment.

label: pH meter
definition: A device that is used to measure the pH (acidity or alkalinity) of a liquid.

label: digital camera
definition: An image acquisition device that takes video or still photographs, or both, digitally by recording images via an electronic image sensor.

label: chip spotting device
definition: A device for dropping and immobilizing a solution of biomolecules, for example, nucleic acids such as probe DNA, mRNA, and peptide nucleic acid (PNA), and proteins on a DNA microarray surface to manufacture a DNA microarray.

label: RNA extraction/purification instrument
definition: A device that is used to isolate and collect RNA for subsequent molecular analysis.

label: two-photon laser/detector
definition: A light source used in fluorescence imaging that allows the imaging of living tissue up to a depth of 1 mm, based on the concept that two photons of low energy can excite a fluorophore in a quantum event, resulting in the emission of a fluorescence photon, typically at a higher energy than either of the two excitatory photons.

label: electrophoresis system
definition: A device that moves charged particles through a medium by using an electric field induced by electrodes.

label: PET synthesizer
definition: A device that is used to produce targeted molecular pharmaceuticals for use in positron emission tomography.

label: spinning-disk confocal microscope
definition: A confocal microscope that uses a Nipkow disk, a mechanical, geometrically operating image scanning device.

label: DNA synthesizer
definition: An oligonucleotide synthesizer that is used to custom-build DNA molecules to contain a particular sequence of nucleotides.

label: high performance liquid chromatography instrument
definition: A liquid chromatography instrument that consists of a reservoir of mobile phase, a pump, an injector, a separation column, and a detector. The pump (rather than gravity) provides the higher pressure required to propel the mobile phase and analyte through the densely packed column.

label: microplate reader
definition: A measurement device that detects biological, chemical or physical events of samples in microtiter plates.

label: ELISA microplate reader
definition: A microplate reader that is used for enzyme-linked immunosorbent assays (ELISA).

label: spot cutter
definition: A robotic device that is used to excise spots from gels.

label: microwave synthesis system
definition: A device that is used to apply microwave irradiation to chemical reactions.

label: densitometer
definition: A device that measures the degree of darkness (the optical density) of a photographic or semitransparent material or of a reflecting surface.

label: automatic staining machine
definition: A device that is used to automatically stain tissue sections on slides or tissue specimens.
function: addition of molecular tracer function|mechanical function

label: automatic tissue processor
definition: A device for processing histological tissue having a tissue carrier basket suspended from a turntable overlying a plurality of beakers suspended from a carrier plate. The turntable is raised, indexed, and lowered by a suitable driving mechanism to move the tissue basket sequentially through the beakers. Timers can each be programmed to control the movement of the turntable to provide various different cycles for processing the tissue. Some of the beakers are received in individual thermal baths to heat and control the temperature of the substances received in the beakers for treating the tissue.

label: stereo microscope
definition: An optical microscope that uses two separate optical paths with two objectives and two eyepieces to provide slightly different viewing angles to the left and right eyes.

label: top loading balance
definition: A balance that consists of a metal plate on which to place an object and a digital readout of the measurement of its mass.

label: perfusion station
definition: A device or system in which perfusion units are integrated.

label: SPECT scanner
definition: A nuclear medicine tomographic imaging device that uses gamma rays to provide 3D information, typically presented as cross-sectional slices through the specimen but with the ability to be freely reformatted or manipulated as required.

label: scintillation counter
definition: A device that is used to measure ionizing radiation.

label: programmable array microscope
definition: A confocal microscope that uses a programmable spatial light modulator for generating an arbitrary pattern of conjugate illumination and detection apertures.
definition source: Verveer et al, Journal of Microscopy, vol. 189, pt. 3, pp. 192-8

label: cryostat
definition: A device consisting of a vessel, similar in construction to a vacuum flask, that is used to maintain cold cryogenic temperatures. FIX THIS DEFINITION

label: microtome knife maker
definition: A glass cutting and breaking device that is used to produce glass knives used in ultramicrotomy.

label: cryofixation device
definition: A device that is used for the fixation or stabilization of biological materials as the first step in specimen preparation for electron microscopy.

label: hybridization oven
definition: A device that creates an appropriate environment for nucleic acid hybridization.

label: incubator shaker
definition: An incubating device that provides shaking motion for biomedical applications (e.g., cell cultures).

label: small-animal image acquisition device
definition: A device that is used to image small laboratory animals (e.g., rats and mice) in vivo.

label: infrared image acquisition device
definition: An image acquisition device that is responsive to an infrared emissive target within a given field of view.

label: confocal microscope
definition: A microscope that is used to increase micrograph contrast and/or reconstruct three-dimensional images by using a spatial pinhole to eliminate out-of-focus light in specimens that are thicker than the focal plane.

label: patch clamp device
definition: A device used in electrophysiology that allows the study of single or multiple ion channels in cells.

label: gel imaging system
definition: A device that is used to acquire images of laboratory gels.

label: protein separation apparatus
definition: A device that is used for the separation of proteins.

label: multichannel electronic pipette
definition: A multichannel pipette that can be programmed by the user to aspirate a volume of liquid reagent or sample and dispense the aspirated volume or a series of aliquots in successive dispensing operations.

label: vitrification apparatus
definition: A device that is used to effect the transition of a substance into a glass.

label: radiography instrument
definition: An image acquisition device that uses ionizing electromagnetic radiation such as X-rays to view objects.

label: radiation measurement device
definition: A device that consists of a radiosensitive detector and a means of recording the effects of radiation on the detector.

label: lyophilizer
definition: A device that is used to freeze dry material.

label: tandem mass spectrometer
definition: A mass spectrometer in which ions are subjected to two or more sequential stages of analysis (which may be separated spatially or temporally) according to the quotient mass/charge.

label: microhardness tester
definition: A hardness testing device that is used in light-optical microscopes.

label: multimode microplate reader
definition: A microplate reader that can detect multiple types of absorbance, luminescence or fluorescence.

label: mechanical balance
definition: A balance that is used to compare the weights of two bodies, to determine the difference in mass (or weight).

label: computer cluster
definition: A group of linked computers, working together closely so that in many respects they form a single computer.

label: microtome knife sharpener
definition: A device that is used to sharpen knives used in microtomy.

label: plate shaker
definition: A device that provides shaking motion for microplates.

label: coagulation analyzer
definition: A device for automatically analyzing blood coagulation in a clinical laboratory.

label: laser capture microdissection microscope
definition: A microscope that uses low-energy laser beams and special transfer film to lift single cells from a tissue.

label: liquid extraction robot
definition: A liquid handling device that provides automatic liquid extraction.

label: ultrasound machine
definition: A device that is used to visualize subcutaneous body structures including tendons, muscles, joints, vessels and internal organs.

label: immunoblot scanner
definition: A device that is used for the imaging of immunoblots.

label: microcentrifuge
definition: A type of centrifuge that is designed for small tubes (0.2 ml to 2.0 ml), has a compact design, and has a small footprint.

label: electronic repeater pipette
definition: A micropipette that can be programmed by the user to aspirate a volume of liquid reagent or sample and dispense a series of aliquots in successive dispensing operations.

label: electron paramagnetic resonance spectrometer
definition: An spectrophotometer that is used to investigate chemical species that have one or more unpaired electrons, such as organic and inorganic free radicals or inorganic complexes possessing a transition metal ion.

label: rocker
definition: A device that provides three-dimensional motion for biomedical applications (e.g., gel trays).

label: analytical balance
definition: A balance with weighing pan(s) inside a transparent enclosure that is used to measure mass to a very high degree of precision and accuracy.

label: scanning force microscope
definition: A microscope that forms images of surfaces using a physical probe that scans the specimen.

label: pulsed-field gel electrophoresis system
definition: A gel electrophoresis system in which the gel matrix is subjected to an electric field that periodically changes direction.

label: tissue embedding station
definition: A device that is used to perform paraffin embedding of tissue specimens.

label: nucleic acid sequencer
definition: An device that is used to determine the order of nucleotides in nucleic acid sequences.

label: bead array reader
definition: A device that is used to acquire and image bead array data.

label: real-time PCR machine
definition: An PCR instrument that enables both detection and quantification of one or more specific sequences in a DNA sample.

label: paraffin oven
definition: A device that is used for the warming of paraffin embedding medium.

label: autoclave
definition: A device that is used to sterilize equipment and supplies by subjecting them to high pressure steam at 121 C or more, typically for 15 to 20 minutes depending on the size of the load and the contents.
definition source: J. Black, Microbiology, Prentice Hall (1993) pg. 334; http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autoclave

label: diffractometer

label: microdissection instrument

label: micropipette puller

label: laser scanning confocal microscope

label: digital microscope
definition: A microscope that uses optics and a charge-coupled device (CCD) camera to output a digital image to a monitor.

label: freeze substitution system
definition: A device or system for dehydrating and then chemically fixing electron microscopy samples at low temperatures in preparation for various treatments including embedding in resins.

label: micropipette

label: voltage clamp device

label: vacuum oven

label: balance

label: surface plasmon resonance instrument
definition: A tool for measuring adsorption of material onto planar metal (typically gold and silver) surfaces or onto the surface of metal nanoparticles.

label: protein sequencer
definition: An device that is used to determine the order of amino acids in protein sequences.

label: X-ray source
definition: A device that is used to generate X-rays.

label: liquid chromatography instrument
definition: A chromatography device that dissolves a mixture in liquid mobile phase to separate the analyte to be measured from other molecules in the mixture and allows it to be isolated

label: SNP microarray

label: assay array
definition: A device made to be used in an analyte assay for immobilization of substances that bind the analyte at regular spatial positions on a surface.

definition: An Illumina methylation BeadChip which is an array that interrogates ~ 850,000 methylation sites per sample at single-nucleotide resolution.

label: Leica Peloris rapid tissue processor
definition: An automatic tissue processor that is a dual retort tissue processor manufactured by the Leica company to provide fast, high quality tissue processing for histology laboratories.

label: Microm Ergostar HM200
definition: A microtome that is manufactured by Microm and uses a vertical cutting stroke common to all rotary microtomes engaged by a horizontal sliding movement. An operating arm replaces the handwheel and is attached to both sides of the instrument for greater convenience to permit control of sectioning from the left or right.

label: microtome blade
definition: A device that is the part of a microtome used to slice specimens to a desired thickness.

label: Sakura Low profile Accu-Edge microtome blade
editor preferred term: Sakura Low profile Accu-Edge microtome blade
definition: A microtome blade that is manufactured by Feather and is disposable. The ultra-sharp blades section specimens without striations, distortion or chattering.

label: microraft
definition: A material separation device also commerically known as Isoraft, that is used to isolate single cells.
term editor: Stephen A. Fisher, Junhyong Kim, Dan Berrios

label: pipette
definition: A device that is a laboratory tool commonly used in chemistry, biology and medicine to transport a measured volume of liquid, often as a media dispenser.
term editor: Stephen A. Fisher, Junhyong Kim, Dan Berrios

label: nCounter Mouse miRNA Expression array
definition: A mouse array which is manufacutred by NanoString Technologies. Built upon color-coded molecular barcodes technology, the array profiles miRNA with increased specificity and sensitivty than microarrays.
example of usage: Kolbert, Christopher P., et al. ""Multi-platform analysis of microRNA expression measurements in RNA from fresh frozen and FFPE tissues."" PloS one 8.1 (2013): e52517. PMID:23382819
term editor: PERSON: Venkat Malladi, Chris Stoeckert, Jie Zheng, Alan Ruttenberg.  Mark A. Miller added based on http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0002013

label: digital acquisition card
alternative label: DAQ device|digital acquisition and digital generation card
definition: The digital acquisition card acts as the interface between the computer and a measurement device via the computer bus. It converts the signal generated by a measurement device (output from device) to a digital signal via an analog-to-digital converter, ADC. It also converts a digital signal to an analog signal via a digital-to-analog converter, DAC. This analog signal (e.g., stimulus) is fed to a measurement device (input to device).

label: Illumina NovaSeq 6000
definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with two flow cells and an output of up to 6000 Gb (32-40 B reads per run). The sequencer utilizes synthesis technology and patterned flow cells to optimize throughput and even spacing of sequencing clusters.
example of usage: Genomic DNA of Xenophilus sp. E41 was extracted and sequenced using an Illumina NovaSeq 6000 system.

label: PacBio Sequel
definition: A DNA sequencer built upon single molecule real-time sequencing technology, optimized for generation with long reads and high consensus accuracy, and manufactured by the Pacific Biosciences corporation
example of usage: The cDNAs were sequenced on the PacBio Sequel platform.

label: PacBio Sequel II
definition: A DNA sequencer built upon single molecule real-time sequencing technology, optimized for generation of highly accurate (""HiFi"") long reads, and which is manufactured by the Pacific Biosciences corporation.
example of usage: The cDNAs were sequenced on the PacBio Sequel II platform.

label: vacuum-assisted biopsy needle
definition: A core biopsy needle integrated with a vacuum system which facilitates the collection of specimen material.
example of usage: Vacuum-assisted biopsy needles come in two varieties: a non-tethered design and a needle design requiring tethering cable to a vacuum source.

label: glass bottle
definition: A container with a narrow neck that is made of glass.

label: glass bottle coated with insecticides
definition: A glass bottle that coated with material designed to control insects.

label: Oxford Nanopore MinION
definition: A portable DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Oxford Nanopore Technologies corporation, that uses consumable flow cells producing up to 30 Gb of DNA sequence data per flow cell. The sequencer produces real-time results and utilizes nanopore technology with up to 512 nanopore channels in the sensor array.
example of usage: Approaches to Whole Mitochondrial Genome Sequencing on the Oxford Nanopore MinION

label: Oxford Nanopore GridION Mk1
alternative label: Oxford Nanopore GridION X5, GridION Mk1
definition: A DNA sequencer that is manufactured by the Oxford Nanopore Technologies corporation, that can run and analyze up to five individual flow cells producing up to 150 Gb of data per run. The sequencer produces real-time results and utilizes nanopore technology with the option of running the flow cells concurrently or individually.
example of usage: Nineteen libraries were constructed and sequenced on nineteen different R9.4 FlowCells using the GridION X5 sequencer

label: Oxford Nanopore PromethION
definition: A DNA sequencer that is manufactured by the Oxford Nanopore Technologies corporation, capable of running up to 48 flow cells and producing up to 7.6 Tb of data per run. The sequencer produces real-time results and utilizes Nanopore technology, with each flow cell allowing up to 3,000 nanopores to be sequencing simultaneously.
example of usage: Structural variants identified by Oxford Nanopore PromethION sequencing of the human genome.

label: personal protective device
definition: A device which is a wearable garment designed to protect the wearer's body from injury or infection.
example of usage: PPE is equipment worn by a worker to minimize exposure to specific hazards.|Examples of PPE include respirators, gloves, aprons, fall protection, and full body suits, as well as head, eye and foot protection.

label: face mask
definition: A personal protective device worn over the nose and mouth as a respiratory filter to inhibit the flow of particles.
example of usage: A systematic review on the efficacy of face coverings against respiratory viruses analyzed 19 randomized trials and concluded that use of face masks and respirators appeared to be protective in both health care and community settings

label: non-medical mask
definition: A face mask not manufactured according to medical equipment standards.
example of usage: A non-medical mask may contain fabrics that are not regulated for use in surgical masks or respirators, or may not be designed to form a seal around the nose and mouth.

label: medical mask
definition: A face mask manufactured according to a recognized medical equipment standard.
example of usage: The finding of a much higher rate of infection in the cloth mask arm could be interpreted as harm caused by cloth masks, efficacy of medical masks, or most likely a combination of both.

label: N95 respirator
alternative label: N95 respirator mask|N95|N95 facemask|N95 face mask
definition: A face mask that meets the U.S. National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH) N95 classification of air filtration, meaning that it filters at least 95% of incoming airborne particles.

label: face shield
definition: A personal protective device used to protect the wearer's entire face (or part of it) from hazards such as flying objects and road debris, chemical splashes, or alternately potentially infectious materials.

label: patient gown
definition: A personal protective clothing item which is a gown designed for use by a patient to facilitate caregiving by medical staff.

label: scrubs
definition: A personal protective clothing item which is sterilized and which is worn by a health care professional.  It can reference a shirt and pants or dress, and depending on medical protocol, may include a medical cap.
example of usage: Examples consist of a short-sleeve V-necked shirt and drawstring pants or a short-sleeve calf-length dress, a tie-back or bouffant-style cap, a mask, a surgical gown, latex gloves, and supportive closed-toe shoes.

label: reusable patient gown
definition: A patient gown intended to be reused after being laundered.

label: disposable patient gown
definition: A patient gown intended for a single period of continuous use and then disposed of.

label: medical gown
definition: A personal protective clothing item which is a gown worn by a medical professional in order to provide a barrier between patient and professional.

label: apron
definition: A garment which is worn over other clothing and covers mainly the front of the body.

label: surgical gown
definition: A medical gown which is subjected to a sterilization process and which is intended to be worn by a medical professional during surgical procedures.

label: personal protective glove
definition: A personal protective device which is a glove.

label: personal protective clothing item
definition: A personal protective device which consists of a garment that serves in place of or in addition to regular body clothing.

label: laboratory coat
definition: A personal protective clothing item which is an overcoat worn by medical or laboratory professionals.

label: medical glove
definition: A personal protective glove which is disposable and is used during medical examinations and procedures to help prevent cross-contamination between caregivers and patients.

label: nitrile glove
definition: A personal protective glove which is made out of nitrile rubber.

label: transparent droplet barrier
definition: A device which is a transparent constructed barrier, usually made out of acrylic (Plexiglass) or polycarbonate plastic, installed in facilities to intercept respiratory droplets, encourage physical distancing requirements.

label: footwear cover
definition: A personal protective device which is an impermiable material which covers a shoe or boot in order to prevent spread of specific environmental contaminants.

label: disposable footwear cover
definition: A footwear cover which is designed for a single period of continuous use and then disposed of.

label: reusable footwear cover
definition: A footwear cover which is designed for repeated use.

label: surgical N95 respirator
alternative label: medical respirator|healthcare respirator|surgical N95|surgical N95 respirator
definition: A N95 respirator which has been approved by the FDA as a surgical mask.

label: protective coverall
definition: A personal protective clothing item which is a loose fitting coverall for ease of movement, with sleeves, full leggings and often a hood to cover the head. These can also include overshoe pieces to cover footwear and protect against contamination.

label: protective sleeve
definition: A personal protective clothing item which is a protective cover worn over the arm.
example of usage: A protective sleeve can be designed to provide protection from heat, welding spatter or hot metal, chemicals, sharp objects, paint or other liquids.

label: protective apron
definition: A personal protective clothing item which is an apron.

label: medical cap
alternative label: surgical hat|bouffant hat|bouffant cap|scrub cap|medical bonnet
definition: A personal protective device which is worn on the head that helps prevent transmission of contaminants contained in hair and scalp.

label: specimen collection device
definition: A device used to collect a specimen.

label: chromatography vial
definition: A vial with cap and container material suited to optical, sanitary and handling requirements of chromatography.

label: specimen pad
alternative label: sampling sponge|specimen sponge|swab|polysponge|surface wipe|absorbant pad|sample pad
definition: A sample collection device consisting of a soft flexible, absorbent pad usually made from natural material such as gauze or cotton, used to absorb specimen fluid or particulate matter.
example of usage: An absorbent pad and its accompanying container are designed to provide safe storage and transport to various degrees for diagnostic and clinical samples, infectious and hazardous materials, chemicals, pharmaceuticals and environmental samples.

label: specimen collection swab stick
definition: A specimen collection device which is a specimen pad attached to a long handle used to collect specimen material.
example of usage: A swab stick allows a worker to collect samples without touching the inside of the bag

label: cotton swab
definition: A device which is a cotton pad mounted on one or both ends of a stick.

label: drag swab
definition: A specimen collection device consisting of a specimen pad made of sterile gauze which is aseptically attached to a pole by clips or to a string

label: pre-moistened swab stick
definition: A specimen collection swab stick that is pre-moistened with liquid prior to sampling.

label: surface wipe
definition: A sample collection device consisting of a thin, less absorbent sheet, used to collect material from surfaces.
example of usage: Surface sampling procedures involved the use of polyester wipes, swabs, contact slides (two types), and adhesive tapes; a gelatin filter was used to sample the air.

label: catheter
definition: A device which is a flexible tube inserted into a body and which enables transfer of fluids into or out of a body.
example of usage: A catheter left inside the body, either temporarily or permanently, may be referred to as an indwelling catheter.

label: ultraviolet light source
definition: A light source that provides ultraviolet (UV) light for use in a distant area using a delivery system.

label: visible light source
definition: A light source that provides visible light for use in a distant area using a delivery system.

label: solar light source
definition: A light source that light is produced from solar energy.

label: arthropod trap
definition: A device designed to catch arthropods.

label: artificial pit shelter
definition: An arthropod trap, consisting of a pit dug in the ground to provide a space for arthropods to rest and be collected.

label: baited net trap
definition: An arthropod trap designed to work with an animal (which could be human) inside a netted structure. This structure is designed so that an arthropod, attracted by the animal, can fly into the netted structure but can neither escape nor reach the animal.

label: barrier trap
definition: An arthropod trap consisting of a static physical barrier designed to funnel arthropods in flight into a container.

label: BG-Counter
definition: A device manufactured by BioGents that is designed to count mosquitoes passing through the device, differentiating the mosquitoes from other arthropods.

label: BG-Sentinel trap
definition: An arthropod trap that is manufactured by Biogents and is designed to attract arthropods through the use of a motorized fan to mimic convection currents produced by a human. The current also pulls arthropods into the trap, where a layer of gauze prevents the arthropods from escaping along with the air current.

label: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention light trap
definition: A light trap that is designed similarly to the New Jersey trapin that it uses motorized suction and light attractantand is powered by a six-volt battery.
editor note: This trap is also designed to be lightweight and operate in environments in which electricity may be scarce.

label: dipper for arthropod immatures
definition: A device that is designed for the collection of arthropod larvae or pupae from water and has the shape of a ladle or a pan.

label: encephalitis virus surveillance trap
definition: A light trap that uses carbon dioxide as attractant. The trap consists of a container of dry ice with holes in the bottom to allow the carbon dioxide to flow downward into a separate container, in which a motorized fan creates suction to collect arthropods.

label: gravid trap
definition: An arthropod trap that is designed to collect gravid female arthropods or their eggs.

label: light trap
definition: An arthropod trap that uses light as an attractant.

label: light trap for indoor use
definition: A light trap designed to be placed inside a building.

label: light trap for outdoor use
definition: A light trap designed to be placed outside a building.

label: Mosquito Magnet Pro trap
definition: An arthropod trap that is powered by propane and is designed to emit a combination of carbon dioxide, heat, water, and oct-1-en-3-ol attractants while simultaneously using suction to trap arthropods.

label: MosquiTRAP
definition: A gravid trap consisting of an arthropod attractant and adhesive surface.

label: New Jersey light trap
definition: A light trap that is designed to use motorized suction to trap arthropods in a collection bag once they approach the light attractant.

label: Onderstepoort Veterinary Institute light-suction trap
definition: A light trap that is designed to use motorized suction to trap arthropods in a collection bag once they approach the attractant. The light is supplied by an 8 watt tube, and the fan providing the suction has an 11-centimeter diameter.

label: outlet window trap
definition: An arthropod trap that is positioned adjacent to a window of a building and is designed to collect arthropods flying out of the building.

label: ovitrap
definition: An arthropod trap that consists of a container holding a mesh layer above water and is designed to trap arthropods hatched from eggs dropped over the water by gravid females.

label: resting arthropod trap
definition: An arthropod trap that is designed to be attractive to an arthropod as a place to rest during a period of inactivity.

label: resting box trap
definition: An arthropod trap that consists of a box that is open on one end. The placement of the box and modifications to it are done in such a way that it becomes attractive to an arthropod as a place to rest during a period of inactivity.

label: resting bucket
definition: An arthropod trap that consists of a bucket, which is lined with fabric and placed on its side, and a wet cloth inside the bucket. The placement of the box and modifications to it are done in such a way that it becomes attractive to an arthropod as a place to rest during a period of inactivity (not actively seeking a host).

label: Shannon trap
definition: An arthropod trap that is made of cloth and netting and is designed to be suspended from above (e.g. from a tree). It is also designed so that the arthropod enters the trap from beneath, being attracted to some bait, and is prevented from escaping upward by the suspended cloth, which allows them to be collected from the upper interior of the trap.

label: sticky resting bucket
definition: An arthropod trap that consists of a bucket, which is lined with adhesive and placed on its side, and a wet cloth inside the bucket. The placement of the box and modifications to it are done in such a way that it becomes attractive to an arthropod as a place to rest during a period of inactivity. The trap is designed for arthropods to become caught in the adhesive so that they can be collected.

label: sticky trap
definition: An arthropod trap that is designed to capture arthropods resting on a surface by coating the surface with adhesive.

label: device for collection of resting adult arthropods
definition: A device that is designed to provide a solid surface that is attractive to an arthropod as a place to rest during a period of inactivity.

label: well net for arthropod immatures
definition: A device that is designed for the collection of arthropod larvae or pupae from water and consists of a conical net.

label: arthropod trap containing small non-human animal bait
alternative label: trap containing small non-human animal bait
definition: An arthropod trap that uses as attractant an animal that is not human and is the size of a chicken or smaller.

label: trap for emerging adult arthropods
definition: An arthropod trap that is designed to trap an arthropod as it emerges from water at the beginning of its adult stage.
definition source: VSMO:0001352|American Midland Naturalist, Vol. 97, No. 2 (Apr., 1977), pp. 381-389

label: free-standing window trap
definition: An arthropod trap that consists of a transparent window placed in a box that holds a liquid solution deadly to arthropods. This trap is designed to stop an arthropod in flight, causing it to fall into the liquid and die.
example of usage: Jonsson developed a free-standing window trap consisting of a 16 x 20-cm perspex box, 16 cm high and divided in the middle by a 20 x 36-cm sheet of perspex (window).  The two compartments of the box are filled to a depth of about 12 cm with 4-6% formalin containing a few drops of detergent; in winter ethylene glycol can be added to prevent freezing.  One or two holes drilled in one side of the box at 12 cm and covered with fine netting prevent the trap overflowing after heavy rain.  Traps are mounted on aluminium poles.  Flying insects on hitting the transparent vertical plastic window fall into the formalin.  The window trap may catch vectors that are seeking a host or moving for other purposes. [ISBN:9781402066658]

label: BG-lure scent dispenser
definition: A device manufactured by BioGents that is designed for operation with the BG-Sentinel trap and releases an attractant that mimics the scent of human skin.

label: hand-held sweep net
definition: A device that consists of a network of mesh and is designed to capture adult arthropods.

label: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention gravid trap
definition: A gravid trap that consists of a pan holding a hay infusion, motorized fan, and collection bag. This trap is designed to attract gravid female arthropods to the infused material, which would serve as an oviposition medium, and then draw them into the bag with the current generated by the fan.
example of usage: The original trap CDC gravid trap (or gravid trap of Reiter) consists of a 3 inch diameter PVC inlet tube housing a 6 V motor, as used in CDC traps, on which is mounted a four-bladed 3 inch counter-clockwise fan. The inlet tube is clamped between two vertical wooden boards that fit over a black plastic box (18.5 x 14.0 x 6.5 inches). A plastic 12 inch long PVC chimney slots into the upper end of the inlet tube. The top half consists of three struts that fit into and support a netting collecting bag. For this the middle of the collecting bag is reinforced with a circular patch of denim cloth. The oviposition attractant is made by adding 1 lb of hay and 1 oz each of dried brewer's yeast and lactalbumen powder to 30 gallons of tap water. This infusion is allowed to mature for 5 days. This original gravid mosquito trap of Reiter suffers from certain limitations, namely up to 10% of the catch of adults is damaged by passing through the fan blades, and adults tend to die of desiccation. [ISBN:9781402066658]

label: Illumina MiniSeq
definition: A small benchtop DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation with integrated cluster generation, sequencing and data analysis. The sequencer accommodates various flow cell configurations and can produce up to 25M single reads or 50M paired-end reads per run.
example of usage: Whole genome sequencing of Klebsiella pneumoniae ST11 was performed using an Illumina Miniseq Sequencing System. PMID:31493526

label: mosquito membrane feeding device
definition: A device that contains blood in a membrane penetrable to mosquitoes, designed to feed mosquitoes without the need for an animal host.

label: assay kit
definition: A device that consists of reagents and devices that enable the performance of a specific type of assay, which could, in addition, require specific instruments not included in the kit.
example of usage: Glutathione S-Transferase (GST) Assay Kit: https://www.sigmaaldrich.com/deepweb/assets/sigmaaldrich/product/documents/101/301/cs0410bul.pdf

label: Illumina HiSeq 1500
definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with a single flow cell. Built upon sequencing by synthesis technology, the machine employs dual surface imaging and offers two high-output options and one rapid-run option.

label: Illumina NextSeq 550
definition: A DNA sequencer manufactured by the Illumina corporation, which provides the increased flexibility of microarray scanning in addition to sequencing.

label: Agilent-026655 Whole Mouse Genome Microarray 4x44K v2
editor preferred term: Agilent-026655 Whole Mouse Genome Microarray 4x44K v2
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured with Agilent 60-mer SurePrint Technology .The SurePrint G3 Mouse Gene Expression 4x44K v2 Microarray provide full coverage of the mouse transcriptome using the latest annotation databases, including long non-coding RNA(lncRNA). Each glass slide is formatted with four high-definition 44K arrays.

label: Agilent-030493 SurePrint G3 Mouse Exon 4x180K Microarray
editor preferred term: Agilent-030493 SurePrint G3 Mouse Exon 4x180K Microarray
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured with Agilent 60-mer SurePrint Technology for studying exon-level gene expression changes. The SurePrint G3 Mouse Exon 4x180K Microarray include probes targeting individual exons. Each glass slide formatted with four 180K arrays.

label: Agilent-074809 SurePrint G3 Mouse GE v2 8x60K Microarray
editor preferred term: Agilent-074809 SurePrint G3 Mouse GE v2 8x60K Microarray
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured with Agilent 60-mer SurePrint technology which provides comprehensive coverage of genes and transcripts using the latest annotation databases. The SurePrint G3 Mouse Gene Expression 8x60K v2 Microarray features complete coverage of established RefSeq coding transcripts (NM) from the latest build and updated long non-coding RNA (lncRNA) content to ensure relevant research.Each glass slide formatted with eight high-definition 60K arrays.

label: Affymetrix Mouse Genome 430 2.0 Array
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured by Affymetrix, which includes complete coverage of the GeneChip Mouse Expression Set 430, for analysis of over 39,000 transcripts and variants from more than 34,000 well-characterized mouse genes and UniGene clusters, on a single array. The sequences for this array were selected from GenBank, dbEST, and RefSeq., and sequence clusters cretaed from the UniGene database.

label: Affymetrix Mouse Genome 430A 2.0 Array
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured by Affymetrix for gene expression analysis focusing on approximately 14,000 well-characterized genes in the transcribed mouse genome using single-array cartridge. Sequences used in the design of the array were selected from GenBank, dbEST, and RefSeq. The sequence clusters were created from the UniGene database.

label: Affymetrix Mouse Gene 1.0 ST Array
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured by Affymetrix, which is a whole-transcript array that includes probes to measure both messenger (mRNA) and long intergenic non-coding RNA transcripts (lincRNA). This whole-transcript array design provides a complete expression profile of mRNA as well as the intermediary lincRNA transcripts that impact the mRNA expression profile.

label: Affymetrix Mouse Gene 2.1 ST Array
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured by Affymetrix, which is a whole-transcript array that includes probes to measure both messenger (mRNA) and long intergenic non-coding RNA transcripts (lincRNA).To supplement the lincRNA data contained in RefSeq, we used sequence and transcript data from lncRNA db.

label: Affymetrix Rhesus Macaque Genome Array
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured by Affymetrix,which is a single-labeled high-density oligonucleotide array, designed to study gene expression in the rhesus animal model and to interrogate rhesus transcripts orthologous to the 3' end of human transcripts. The array consists of over 52,000 probe sets representing more than 20,000 genes, and several relevant viral organisms for studying host-disease immune response.

label: Affymetrix Human Transcriptome Array 2.0
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured by Affymetrix, to go beyond gene-level expression profiling to accurately detect all known transcript isoforms produced by a gene. The array design covers >245,000 coding transcripts, >40,000 non-coding transcripts and >339,000 probe sets covering exon-exon junctions, thus ensuring uniform coverage of the transcriptome.

label: Affymetrix Human Genome U219 Array
alternative label: Applied Biosystems GeneChip PrimeView Human Gene Expression Array
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured by Affymetrix, which comprises more than 530,000 probes covering more than 36,000 transcripts and variants, which represent more than 20,000 genes mapped through RefSeq or via UniGene annotation. Sequences used in the design of the array were selected from the RefSeq version 36, UniGene database 219, and full-length human mRNAs from GenBank.

label: Affymetrix Human Gene 2.0 ST Array
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured by Affymetrix, which provides the most accurate, sensitive, and comprehensive measurement of protein coding (mRNA) and long intergenic non-coding RNA (lincRNA) transcripts. The array design covers >33,500 coding transcripts and >11,000 lincRNA transcripts thus enabling researchers to understand whole-transcriptome gene expression at the gene and exon levels, which allows the study of transcript variants and alternative splicing events.

label: Affymetrix Clariom S Assay, Human
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured by Affymetrix, to obtain a gene-level view of the human transcriptome. The assay design covers >20,000 well-annotated genes, providing researchers with the ability to perform gene-level expression profiling studies, to identify expression biomarkers , and to quickly assess changes in key genes and pathways.

label: Affymetrix Clariom S Assay, Mouse
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured by Affymetrix, to obtain a gene-level view of the mouse transcriptome. The assay design covers >20,000 well-annotated genes, providing researchers with the ability to perform gene-level expression profiling studies, to identify expression biomarkers, and to quickly assess changes in key genes and pathways.

label: Illumina HumanHT-12 V4.0 expression beadchip
definition: An Illumina BeadChip which employs direct-hybridization assay, for whole-genome expression profiling and expression-based quantitative trait loci (eQTL) studies. This BeadChip contains 12 arrays, each featuring more than 48,000 probes, targeting more than 31,000 annotated genes, providing genome-wide coverage of well-characterized genes, gene candidates, and splice variants.

label: Illumina MouseRef-8 v2.0 beadchip
definition: An Illumina BeadChip which employs direct-hybridization assay, for whole-genome expression profiling in the mouse.This Beadchip contains 8 microarrays, featuring more than 25,000 probes per array, derived from the NCBI RefSeq database and supplemented with MEEBO and RIKEN FANTOM2 content.

label: Affymetrix Mouse Exon Junction Array
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured by Affymetrix, used to identify exon-exon junctions associated with alternate splice variants in the mouse transcriptome.

label: Affymetrix Human Exon Junction Array
definition: A DNA microarray manufactured by Affymetrix, used to identify exon-exon junctions associated with alternate splice variants in the human transcriptome.

label: Mosquito Magnet Liberty Plus trap
definition: An arthropod trap that is designed to emit a combination of carbon dioxide, heat, water, and oct-1-en-3-ol attractants while simultaneously using suction to trap arthropods. This trap has the same design as the Mosquito Magnet Pro trap but is smaller, is more lightweight, and uses a main line electricity supply instead of propane to power itself. Both use propane to produce the arthropod attractor.

label: cow-baited arthropod trap
definition: A resting arthropod trap that consists of a tent inside which an adult cow is tethered to the ground, in order to attract arthropods and collect those that rest on the interior walls of the tent.

label: Scrub Typhus Detect IgM ELISA kit
definition: An assay kit that is manufactured by InBios International to use ELISA to test for IgM antibodies for Orientia tsutsugamushi strains Karp, Kato, Gilliam, and TA 716, with a protein microarray that has a 96-well plate and the 56-kDa type-specific antigen.
associated axioms: ('capable of' some 'ELISA measuring Orientia tsutsugamushi IgM antibody')

label: Panbio Dengue IgM capture ELISA kit
definition: An assay kit that is manufactured by Abbott to test for IgM antibodies for Dengue with a two-plate protein microarray. One plate contains stabilized Dengue viruses 1 through 4, and the other plate contains anti-human IgM antibody.
associated axioms: ('capable of' some 'microarray assay measuring Dengue IgM antibody')

label: Panbio Dengue Early ELISA kit
definition: An assay kit that is manufactured by Abbott to detect the NS1 Dengue viral protein with a protein microarray and an anti-NS1 monoclonal antibody.

label: SD Bioline Chikungunya IgM RDT kit
definition: A device manufactured by Abbott for rapid detection of human IgM antibodies for Chikungunya virus in blood, using analytical chromatography.
associated axioms: ('capable of' some 'analytical chromatography measuring Chikungunya IgM antibody')

label: SD Bioline Chikungunya IgM capture ELISA kit
definition: An assay kit that is manufactured by Abbott to detect human IgM antibodies for Chikungunya with a protein microarray and ELISA.
associated axioms: ('capable of' some 'ELISA measuring Chikungunya IgM antibody')

label: Advantage Chikungunya IgM Card kit
definition: An assay kit that is manufactured by J. Mitra to detect human IgM antibodies for Chikungunya virus with a protein microarray and double-antigen sandwich ELISA.
associated axioms: ('capable of' some 'microarray ELISA measuring Chikungunya IgM antibody')

label: odor baited CDC light trap
definition: A CDC light trap that uses odorous gas from a human being as an attractant, by pumping it from the room where the human being sleeps into the trap.
parent class: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention light trap

label: resting clay pot trap
definition: A resting arthropod trap that consists of a container composed primarily of clay.

label: Illumina NextSeq 1000
definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation using sequence-by-synthesis chemistry that fits on a benchtop and uses P1 and P2 flow cells.

label: Illumina Infinium MethylationEPIC v2.0 BeadChip
definition: An Illumina methylation BeadChip that targets  935,000 methylation sites per sample at single-nucleotide resolution.

label: Illumina NovaSeq X
definition: A DNA sequencer with three flow cell types manufactured by Illumina. The NovaSeq X provides an output of up to 8 Tb (26-52 billion reads per run). The sequencer utilizes XLEAP-SBS chemistry, an advanced version of Illumina's sequencing by synthesis (SBS) technology, which enables faster and more accurate sequencing.

label: Illumina NovaSeq X Plus
definition: A DNA sequencer with three flow cell types manufactured by Illumina. It features a dual-flow cell configuration, allowing to reach an output of up to 16 Tb (52-104 billion reads per run). The sequencer utilizes XLEAP-SBS chemistry, an advanced version of Illumina's sequencing by synthesis (SBS) technology, which enables faster and more accurate sequencing.

label: Illumina HiSeq series instrument
definition: A DNA Sequencer manufactured and/or marketed by Illumina and branded with the word HiSeq.
example of usage: https://www.illumina.com/content/dam/illumina-support/documents//products/datasheets/datasheet_hiseq_systems.pdf
editor note: This class represents a series of instruments with various model names. There are several models in this series, including one that was simply called HiSeq as the model name. GENEPIO:0100110 Illumina HiSeq may refer to a model, not the series. OBI may not have classes for all of the instruments in this series.

label: Illumina NextSeq series instrument
definition: A DNA Sequencer manufactured and/or marketed by Illumina and branded with the word NextSeq.
example of usage: https://www.cd-genomics.com/blog/nextseq/
editor note: This class represents a series of instruments with various model names. There are several models in this series. OBI may not have classes for all of the instruments in this series. It is unclear whether GENEPIO:0100126 Illumina NextSeq refers to the series or a model.
